title: A speech of the Honorable Denzell Hollis (second son to the Right Honorable John Earle of Clare deceased) and brother to the now Earle of Clare, at the delivery of the protestation to the Lords of the upper house of Parliament, 4 May 1641 wherein is set forth the reasons that moved the House of Commons to make the said protestation o [ie. to] gether with a short narration of the severall grievances of the Kingdome.
author: Holles, Denzil Holles, Baron, 1599-1680.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed by B.A. and T.F. for Iohn Hammond,
